# Pull Request: Add Contribution Guidelines and Improve Documentation

## Summary
This pull request introduces comprehensive contribution guidelines to the project and enhances the main README with information about how to contribute.

## Changes Made

### 1. Added CONTRIBUTING.md
- Created a detailed contribution guidelines document
- Included sections on getting started, branch naming conventions, commit message guidelines
- Added pull request process and code review guidelines
- Documented community guidelines and types of contributions

### 2. Updated README.md
- Added a "Contributing" section linking to the new CONTRIBUTING.md file
- Updated file count statistics to reflect the new file

## Why This Change is Important
- Makes it easier for new contributors to understand how to participate in the project
- Establishes clear expectations for code quality and collaboration
- Improves the project's readiness for open source contributions
- Follows industry best practices for open source project documentation

## Testing
- Verified that all links in the documentation work correctly
- Ensured the markdown formatting renders properly
- Confirmed that the new files follow the project's existing style

This PR demonstrates proper git collaboration workflows including:
